title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: Create a new "DateTime" type report parameter in BIRT report designer. In the "defaultValue" field, enter an invalid date string, such as "55/66/9999". When doing so, the invalid value is accepted, and the following definition shows up in the report design:<parameters><scalarparameter name="dateParam1"><property name="dataType">dateTime</property><property name="allowBlank">false</property><property name="format">Unformatted</property><property name="controlType">textbox</property><expression name="defaultValue">55/66/9999</expression></scalarparameter></parameters>.
EB: The model should have stored a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss, see [http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema2/]), which is locale-independent, to ensure portability.
SR: To reproduce this issue, create a new "DateTime" type report parameter in BIRT report designer. In the "defaultValue" field, enter an invalid date string, such as "55/66/9999".
